SEARCH
Package fr.esiee.baba.model

Class Rules

java.lang.Object
fr.esiee.baba.model.Rules
public class Rules extends Object
Manages and evaluates the rules that dictate the interactions and behaviors of elements within the level in "BABA IS YOU". This class maps nouns to properties, properties to nouns, and handles transformations and other dynamic changes in the game state.

    Constructs a new Rules object associated with a given level.

  • Constructor Details

    • Rules

      public Rules(Level level)
      Constructs a new Rules object associated with a given level.
      Parameters:
      level - the game level associated with these rules, used to initialize rule mappings based on the level's grid.

  • Method Details

    • initRules

      public void initRules(Level level)
      Initializes or re-initializes the rules based on the current game level's grid. This method scans the grid to establish new rule mappings.
      Parameters:
      level - the level whose grid is scanned to establish rules.

    • addRule

      public void addRule(Element first, Element second, Element third)
      Adds a rule based on three elements where the middle element is always the operator 'IS'.
      Parameters:
      first - the first element (noun)
      second - the second element (operator 'IS')
      third - the third element (noun or property)

    • printMaps

      public void printMaps()
      Prints all mappings from nouns to properties and properties to nouns, as well as any transformation rules. This method is useful for debugging and verifying the current state of the game's rules.

    • getEntityByNoun

      public static Element getEntityByNoun(Noun noun)
      Retrieves the corresponding game element for a given noun.
      Parameters:
      noun - the noun whose corresponding game element is needed.
      Returns:
      the corresponding game element, typically an entity or an empty value if no mapping exists.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the noun is unrecognized, ensuring all nouns have valid mappings.

    • getEntitiesByProperty

      public Set<Element> getEntitiesByProperty(Cellule cell, Property property)
      Retrieves a set of elements with a specified property within a given cell.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell from which to retrieve elements based on a specified property.
      property - the property to check within the cell.
      Returns:
      a set of elements that have the specified property.

    • getWinElements

      public Set<Element> getWinElements(Cellule cell)
      Retrieves the set of elements in a cell that can lead to a win condition.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to check for winning elements.
      Returns:
      a set of elements with the WIN property.

    • getPushableElements

      public Set<Element> getPushableElements(Cellule cell)
      Retrieves the set of elements in a cell that can be pushed according to the current game rules.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to check for pushable elements.
      Returns:
      a set of pushable elements.

    • getStopElements

      public Set<Element> getStopElements(Cellule cell)
      Retrieves the set of elements in a cell that prevent movement, acting as barriers.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to check for stopping elements.
      Returns:
      a set of elements with the STOP property.

    • getYouElements

      public Set<Element> getYouElements(Cellule cell)
      Retrieves the set of elements in a cell designated as "YOU", indicating player-controlled elements.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to check for elements controlled by the player.
      Returns:
      a set of elements with the YOU property.

    • getJumpElements

      public Set<Element> getJumpElements(Cellule cell)
      Retrieves the set of elements in a cell designated as "JUMP", indicating elements that can jump.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to check for elements that can jump.
      Returns:
      a set of elements with the JUMP property.

    • isWin

      public boolean isWin(Cellule cell)
      Determines if the specified cell contains an element that can lead to winning the game.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to check for a winning condition.
      Returns:
      true if the cell contains at least one WIN element, otherwise false.

    • getTransformationRules

      public Map<Noun,Noun> getTransformationRules()
      Retrieves the current set of transformation rules.
      Returns:
      a map of noun transformations that dictate changes in element types upon rule activation.

    • hasProperty

      public boolean hasProperty(Set<Element> elements, Property property)
      Checks if a given set of elements has a specific property.
      Parameters:
      elements - the set of elements to check.
      property - the property to check for.
      Returns:
      true if any of the elements have the property, false otherwise.
